Bei der BMW Bank GmbH, einer 100%igen Tochtergesellschaft der BMW AG, verbindet uns die Begeisterung, unseren Kunden mit modernen Finanzlösungen Freude am Fahren zu vermitteln. Als Teil von BMW Financial Services, einem Geschäftsbereich der BMW Group, zählen wir als Anbieter von Finanzdienstleistungen im Sektor der Automobilbanken zu den erfolgreichsten unserer Branche.Als Geschäftsfeld Controller (m/w/x) sind Sie der Ansprechpartner (w/m/x) zu allen Finanz- und Controllingthemen des von Ihnen betreuten Geschäftsfeldes im Markt Deutschland.Was erwartet Sie? Modellierung der relevanten Planungsparameter, Kommunikation von Zielen und Verfolgung der finanziellen Zielsetzung im Rahmen der Planungsprozesse (Budget, Forecast). Abwicklung des Ist-Reportings (Monats-, Jahresabschluss): Tracken der Zielerreichung. Analysieren und kommentieren von Abweichungen. Durchführung von Produktbewertungen und Detailanalysen von Ergebniskomponenten. Zusammenarbeit mit relevanten Abteilungs- und Gruppenleitern sowie Fachbereiche des von Ihnen zu betreuenden Geschäftsfeldes. Begleitung der Definition, Dokumentation und Prüfung von controllingrelevanten Themengebieten und Datenanforderungen im Zuge von Projekttätigkeiten. Was bringen Sie mit? Ein wirtschaftswissenschaftliches Studium mit den Schwerpunkten Finanzwirtschaft, Rechnungswesen und/oder Controlling sowie erste Berufserfahrung im Bereich Finanzen/Controlling (von Vorteil). Fundierte Kenntnisse und Techniken im Bereich Finanzcontrolling (bspw. Marktzinsmethode und Barwertkonzept). Einen sicheren Umgang mit den MS Office-Produkten, insbesondere mit Excel sowie Datenbankenaffinität und ggf. SQL-Kenntnisse. Einsatzbereitschaft, Eigeninitiative, Kommunikationsfähigkeit und Teamfähigkeit. Analytisches Denken, Zahlenverständnis und selbstbewusstes Auftreten. Einen hohen Qualitätsanspruch an sich selbst und andere. Fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift. Was bieten wir Ihnen? 30 Urlaubstage. Attraktive Vergütung. Hohe Work-Life-Balance. BMW & MINI Angebote. Flexible Arbeitszeitgestaltung. Karriereentwicklung. Mobilitätsangebote. Und vieles mehr, siehe bmw.jobs/waswirbieten. Sind Sie motiviert und haben Lust, mit uns die Mobilität von morgen zu gestalten? Bewerben Sie sich jetzt!Hinweis: Bitte bewerben Sie sich ausschließlich online über unser Karriereportal. Bewerbungen auf anderen Kanälen (insb. auch Email) können nicht berücksichtigt werden.Bei der BMW Group verstehen wir Diversität und Inklusion in all ihren Dimensionen als Stärke für unsere Teams. Chancengleichheit ist uns ein besonderes Anliegen, die Gleichbehandlung von Bewerber:innen sowie Mitarbeiter:innen ein grundlegendes Prinzip unserer Unternehmenspolitik. Daher basieren auch unsere Recruiting-Entscheidungen auf ihrer Persönlichkeit, ihren Erfahrungen und Fähigkeiten.Mehr zu Diversity bei der BMW Group unter bmwgroup.jobs/diversityStartdatum: ab 01.02.2023Anstellungsart: befristet (24 Monate)Arbeitszeit: FULLTIMEAnsprechpartner:BMW Bank GmbHHerr Bauer+49 89 3184 – 6191 Mehr anzeigen Weniger anzeigen

MANCHE IT FUNKTIONIERT. MANCHE VERSCHIEBT GRENZEN.TEILE DEINE LEIDENSCHAFT.Um Automobilgeschichte zu schreiben, braucht es Spezialisten, die große Herausforderungen ebenso schätzen wie ein einzigartiges Arbeitsumfeld. Agile Arbeitsweisen in kleinen Teams sind bei uns ebenso selbstverständlich wie das Testen der eigenen Codes am Fahrzeug durch den Einsatz von Cutting-Edge-Technologie. Mit smarten, innovativen IT-Lösungen gelingt es unseren Teams immer wieder, die Grenzen des Möglichen neu zu definieren.Wir gestalten die Used Vehicle Prozesse in den BMW-Vertriebsgesellschaften und der BMW-Handelsorganisation weltweit. Dazu ist in unserer Domäne „Used Vehicle“ eine Vielzahl von IT-Systemen im Einsatz, um die Prozesse optimal zu unterstützen. Was erwartet dich? Du übernimmst die E2E Verantwortung für die Themen und kommunizierst an die Stakeholder. Die Detaillierung und Umsetzung von Anforderungen über die gesamte System-/ Subproduktlandschaft gehört zu deinen Aufgaben. Du bist für die Delivery zuständig und unterstützt tatkräftig bei der Erstellung, Einplanung und Abnahme der Projektmeilensteine. Die Test- und Betriebsverantwortung der Deliverys des Feature Teams ist Teil deiner Tätigkeit. Du unterstützt bei der Schaffung von robusten und skalierbaren Strukturen und der architekturellen Ausrichtung des Produktes sowie bei der Integration in die Architektur der benachbarten Produkte. Du bringst zudem neue technologische Möglichkeiten und Optimierungsmaßnahmen ein. Was bringst du mit? Studienabschluss in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation. Mehrjährige (mind. 3 – 5 Jahre) Berufserfahrung in der technischen Konzeption von verteilten IT Systemen. Fundierte Java Kenntnisse in Architektur, Design und Implementierung. Kenntnisse in der Konzeption, Entwicklung, Test und Wartung moderner Microservice Architekturen. Idealerweise Kenntnisse einer oder mehrerer der folgenden Technologien: Quarkus, Payara Micro, Docker, AWS, APIgee, PostgreSQL. Wünschenswert sind Erfahrungen im Umfeld von Vertriebssystemen für Gebrauchtfahrzeuge. Kenntnisse der Fahrzeug-, Händler- und Endkundenprozesse im Gebrauchtfahrzeugvertrieb. Grunderfahrungen Erfahrung in der Software-Entwicklung mit agiler Methodik (z.B. Scrum, Kanban) und im Projektmanagement. Verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse. Auch hochkomplexe Aufgaben bringen dich nicht aus dem Konzept? Bewirb dich jetzt! Hinweis: Bitte bewirb dich ausschließlich online über unser Karriereportal. Bewerbungen auf anderen Kanälen (insb. auch Email) können nicht berücksichtigt werden. Was bieten wir dir? 30 Urlaubstage. Attraktive Vergütung. BMW & MINI Angebote. Flexible Arbeitszeitgestaltung. Hohe Work-Life Balance. Karriereentwicklung. Mobilitätsangebote. Und vieles mehr siehe bmw.jobs/waswirbieten Bei der BMW Group verstehen wir Diversität und Inklusion in all ihren Dimensionen als Stärke für unsere Teams. MAN KANN VON FUNKTIONEN TRÄUMEN. ODER SIE REALISIEREN.TEILE DEINE LEIDENSCHAFT.Eine innovative Unternehmenskultur in einem so vielschichtigen Konzern wie der BMW Group lebt von komplexen Systemen und Netzwerken. Mit guten Ideen, Begeisterung und Teamgeist entwickeln unsere IT-Spezialisten unverwechselbar smarte und moderne Systeme. Dabei profitieren sie von ausreichend Budgets, aber auch von standardisierten Prozessen, um Lösungen effizienter umzusetzen. So kann eine IT realisiert werden, die neue Möglichkeiten schafft und damit die Basis unserer Unternehmenskultur und unserer Erfolges sichert.In deiner neuen Position gestaltest du den digitalen Auftritt der BMW Group für unsere Kunden. Gemeinsam mit dir stellen sicher, dass der Verkauf unserer Produkte in allen Kanälen genauso hochklassig wahrgenommen wird, wie unsere Produkte selbst. Was erwartet dich? In deiner neuen Rolle bist du verantwortlich für den Aufbau einer flexiblen Datenarchitektur u.a. in der AWS Cloud, um detaillierte Analysen für Europa zu ermöglichen. Du definierst das Technologieset (Tech Stack) für die IT Landschaft in den europäischen Märkten, im Sinne einer Transition in den nächsten Jahren und einer Ziellandschaft 2025+. Dies erarbeitest Du im engen Zusammenspiel mit den lokalen Markt IT Organisationen und den zentralen Produktteams. Du implementierst die BMW Datenstrategie durch Teilen standardisierter Datenbestände über das cloudbasierte Datenmanagementsystem (Data Hub) / Datenportal und stellst eine hohe Datenqualität und stabile Betriebsprozesse über ein Set von nicht-funktionalen Anforderungen sicher. Unmittelbarer Austausch mit diversen Interessensgruppen aus verschiedensten BMW Abteilungen, um die technischen Möglichkeiten mit den wirtschaftlichen Anforderungen zu konsolidieren. Du definierst Anforderungen z.B. im Rahmen von Workshops und managst diese mit den verschiedenen Stakeholdern (Unterschiedliche Fachabteilungen, Entwicklerteams, etc.). Bei der Definition von Produktvisionen und Software Architekturen bis hin zu konkreten, technischen Lösungen berätst du und darüber hinaus bist du Sparring Partner für unsere Projekt Manager in der Projektdurchführung. Die Beratung der beteiligten Fach- und IT-Stellen zum Einsatz neuer Technologien, die Validierung von Entscheidungen und das Aufzeigen von Möglichkeiten, die gemeinsam mit unseren unterschiedlichen Software Teams umgesetzt werden gehört zu deinen Aufgaben. Die Vertretung der (IT) Perspektive der internationalen BMW Vertriebsgesellschaften in einem großen Projekt runden dein Tätigkeitsprofil ab. Was bringst du mit? Universitätsabschluss in Mathematik, Informatik bzw. Wirtschaftsinformatik, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen oder eine mehrjährige praktische Erfahrung mit Datenanalytik in einem ähnlichen Umfeld. Mindestens 5 Jahre praktische Erfahrung mit ETL, Datenmodellierung und Datenarchitekturen. Expertenerfahrung mit AWS Glue, S3, Athena sowie im schreiben und optimieren von SQL, Python, Spark. Kenntnisse über Reporting-Lösungen wie AWS Quicksight, QlikSense etc. sind von Vorteil. Kenntnisse über Technologien im Umfeld maschinelles Lernen, wie SageMaker, ist von Vorteil. Kenntnisse über den Software-Entwicklungszyklus (CI/CD, Testautomatisierung, Konfigurationsmanagement) und sicherer Umgang mit gängigen CI/CD Tools (Terraform/CDK, Jenkins, Sonar etc.) sind von Vorteil. Verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse. Du bist mutig und motiviert, eigene Ideen einzubringen und neue technologische Wege zu gehen? Bewirb dich jetzt! Hinweis: Bitte bewirb dich ausschließlich online über unser Karriereportal. Bewerbungen auf anderen Kanälen (insb. auch Email) können nicht berücksichtigt werden. Was bieten wir dir? 30 Urlaubstage. Attraktive Vergütung. BMW & MINI Angebote. Flexible Arbeitszeitgestaltung. Hohe Work-Life Balance. Karriereentwicklung. Mobilitätsangebote. Und vieles mehr siehe bmw.jobs/waswirbieten Bei der BMW Group verstehen wir Diversität und Inklusion in all ihren Dimensionen als Stärke für unsere Teams. WE MOVE THE WORLD THROUGH SUSTAINABLE AND INTELLIGENT FINANCIAL AND SERVICE SOLUTIONSAls Daimler Truck Financial Services sind wir eines der größten Finanz- und Mobilitätsdienstleistungsunternehmen der Nutzfahrzeugindustrie und ein vollständig integrierter Bereich der global agierenden Daimler Truck AG. Wir vereinfachen das Geschäft unserer Kunden mit einer Vielzahl von maßgeschneiderten Finanzierungs- und Servicelösungen und unterstützen sie auf dem Weg zum umweltfreundlichen, autonomen und sicheren Fahren.Wir sind mit mehr als 1.900 Mitarbeiter:innen in rund 16 Märkten aktiv. Unsere Kolleg:innen und unsere wertebasierte Kultur sind wesentliche Stärken, die maßgeblich zu unserem Erfolg beitragen.#YOUMAKEUS. Werde Teil unseres Contract Teams bei Daimler Truck Financial ServicesUnsere Abteilung entwickelt und betreut das Vertragsmanagementsystem für europäische Konzerngesellschaften (Miles2Market). Dabei achten wir besonders darauf, einen Standard in Prozessen und Funktionen zu gewährleisten. Wir begleiten die Märkte intensiv bei der Einführung des Vertragsmanagementsystems und supporten den operativen Betrieb. Der Teamleiter für das Team Contract Processes steuert und verantwortet die Themengebiete „Contract Management“, „Contract Accounting“, „Data Quality and Governance“ und „Data Migration“.IN DIESER ROLLE WIRST DUDie fachliche und disziplinarische Führung für das Team übernehmen, welches für alle Prozesse nach der Vertragsaktivierung (für die Bereiche Contract Management und Contract Accounting) verantwortlich ist.Den Betrieb und die Optimierung der entsprechenden Prozesse und Systeme verantworten.Sicherstellen, dass eine betriebsbereite und prozessuale End-2-End Lösung über die Kunden- bzw. Vertragslebenszyklen bereitgestellt wird.Zusammen mit dem Team die Verantwortung für die funktionsübergreifenden Themen Datenmigration, Datenqualität und Datenmanagement übernehmen.Ein einheitliches Verständnis zwischen Marktkoordinatoren & Themenverantwortlichen kreieren, um gemeinsame Projektziele zu erreichen. Dazu gehören die Sicherstellung von marktübergreifenden Standardlösungen, der betrieblichen Qualität der Prozesse und Systeme sowie der Einhaltung der erwarteten Qualitätsziele und Zeitleiste.DU SOLLTEST TEIL UNSERES TEAMS SEIN, WEILWir diejenigen sind, die die Welt in Bewegung halten!Du eine Unternehmenskultur erleben wirst, in der Vertrauen, Authentizität, Respekt und Integrität die Grundlage unseres Handelns bilden und wir uns jeden Tag umeinander kümmern.Jeder ermächtigt und unterstützt wird, sich als Individuum zu entwickeln. Du durch eine starke Eigenverantwortung vom ersten Tag an eine steile Lernkurve durchlaufen wirst und dich beruflich und persönlich weiterentwickeln kannst.Du Teil eines globalen Teams mit über 30 Nationalitäten und unterschiedlichen Hintergründen sein wirst. Wir Vielfalt und Inklusion fördern und uns als ein leidenschaftliches und lebensfrohes Team verstehen.DAS BIETEN WIR DIRDein Start bei uns: Wir möchten, dass Du das Steuer gleich selbst in die Hand nimmst und Dich von Anfang an wohl fühlst. Deshalb startest Du bei uns mit einem mehrtägigen Onboarding und einer individuellen Einarbeitung, während der Du Deine neuen Kolleg:innen, unsere Produkte und unsere Kultur kennenlernst.Dein Gehalt: Bei uns profitierst Du von tarifgebundener Vergütung eines Tarifvertrages.Deine Weiterentwicklung: Du findest bei uns ein breites Spektrum an Lern- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten wie z.B. LinkedIn Learning für Deine berufliche und private Weiterbildung. Wir unterstützen Dich mit zielgerichteten Trainings unseres Learning & Development-Teams, das Dich in Deiner persönlichen und fachlichen Entwicklung weiterbringt.Arbeitszeiten: Wir bieten Dir eine flexible Stundenerfassung, die es Dir ermöglicht, Arbeit & Privates unter einen Hut zu bringen.Mobile Office: Auch das ist bei uns möglich! In der Regel bieten wir Dir wöchentlich mehrere Tage mobiles Arbeiten an, stets an die Teambedürfnisse angepasst. Frag gerne direkt im Interview nach, wie die Regelung für Deine Rolle ist.Urlaubstage: Bei uns hast Du 30 Tage Urlaub im Jahr und überdurchschnittlich viele Feiertage (Standort BaWü) sowie bezahlte Freistellungen für wichtige, familiäre Ereignisse (z.B. Hochzeit, Geburt, etc.).Für Dich & Deine Familie: Krankenversicherung über die Mercedes-Benz BKK, betriebliche Altersversorgung und vermögenswirksame Leistungen. Zusätzlich profitierst Du von regelmäßigen Gesundheitstagen mit Gesundheitschecks sowie kostenlosen Impfungen.Kinderbetreuung: Als familienfreundlicher Arbeitgeber helfen wir Dir dabei, Deine Kinder bestmöglich unterzubringen.Fitness: Du bist von der sportlichen Sorte? In unserem Sportverein SG Stern kannst Du je nach Standort verschiedene Sportarten ausprobieren wie Kitesurfen, Tauchen, Eishockey und klassische Fitnessangebote sowie unseren Firmenlauf. Auch eine E-Sports-Community hat sich rund um verschiedene Games und Genres gebildet.Start-up-Flair und Tradition: Als größter Nutzfahrzeughersteller der Welt ist die Daimler Truck AG schon lange am Markt vertreten. Der Bereich Financial Services – unser neues Start-up – zeichnet sich dabei durch seine offene Kultur aus.Vielfalt: Verschiedenste Charaktere machen uns als Company aus! Diversity, Equity & Inclusion haben wir uns schon sehr lange auf die Fahne geschrieben. Deshalb sind bei uns alle Persönlichkeiten willkommen.Standort: (DTFS/D Leinfelden) An unserem wunderschönen Campus in Stuttgart-Leinfelden mit toller Kantine, Kaffeebar, Lounge-Bereich und vielem mehr / (DTFSD Berlin) Unsere modernen und lichtdurchfluteten Büros in der Nähe der East Side Gallery in Berlin – direkt an der Spree!Ob per Auto, Fahrrad oder ÖV: wir sind überall gut erreichbar und unterstützen Dich mit einem Jobbike oder einem PKW zu Sonderkonditionen (Jahres-/Firmenwagen über Mercedes-Benz Membersprogramm). Einen kostenlosen Parkplatz bekommst Du bei Bedarf übrigens auch.Noch mehr: Corporate Benefits mit tollen Angeboten bei einer Vielzahl von externen Partnern (z. B. für Events, Unterhaltungselektronik, Reisen, etc.), Belegschaftsaktien – unsere Liste ist lang. Da ist bestimmt auch etwas für Dich dabei! DU PASST PERFEKT ZU UNS, WENN DUEin abgeschlossenes Studium in Betriebswirtschaftslehre, Wirtschaftswissenschaften oder verwandten Bereichen mitbringst.Bereits mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in verschiedenen Bereichen von Finanzdienstleistungen oder angrenzenden Bereichen mit Relevanz für LKW- und Busdienste nachweisen kannst.Nachweisbare Erfahrungen in internationalen Projekten mitbringst ein Captive Finance Background ist von Vorteil.Fähig bist, in einem interdisziplinären und marktübergreifenden Umfeld zu arbeiten und ein Team in diesem Umfeld leiten kannst.Ein gutes Verständnis von Kunden-, bzw. Vertragslebenszyklen (end-to-end) im Leasing bzw. Finanzierung (für Einzelhandels- und Gewerbekunden) hast.Über eine selbständige, eigenverantwortliche und zuverlässige Arbeitsweise verfügst.Sehr gute Englisch- und Deutschkenntnisse vorweisen kannst.Du bringst nicht alles mit? Kein Problem! We look for skills but hire for attitude!#MAKEYOURMOVE und bewirb Dich jetzt - Wir freuen uns auf Dich! Mehr anzeigen Weniger anzeigen

WE MOVE THE WORLD THROUGH SUSTAINABLE AND INTELLIGENT FINANCIAL AND SERVICE SOLUTIONSAs Daimler Truck Financial Services, we are one of the largest financial and mobility services companies in the commercial vehicle industry and a fully integrated division of the globally operating Daimler Truck AG. We simplify our customers' business with a wide range of tailored financing and service solutions and support them on the road to environmentally friendly, autonomous and safe driving.We are active in around 16 markets with more than 1,900 employees. Our colleagues and our value-based culture are key strengths that contribute significantly to our success.#YOUMAKEUS. Become part of our Credit Risk Management at Daimler Truck Financial ServicesThe department Credit Risk Management is responsible for the monthly calculation of credit risk reserves, for risk steering and reporting for all DTFS entities as well as risk methods and parameters. Furthermore, the department manages rating and scoring models, processes and systems. In addition, the department hosts several policies, prepares Board deals, ensures their quality and fosters the further process and system digitization.IN THIS ROLE YOU WILLSetup, develop and adapt the global Risk Management Policies at DTFS, such as Credit & Product Rules, Scoring & Rating Policies and the Risk Management Definition CatalogueBecome a key contact and communication role for these policies ensuring the correct implementation in the local entities taking into account local regulatory and legal requirementsAnalyze credit risks and other requests (e.g. concentration risk) which require approval by the BoM of DTFS and / or other global authoritiesPerform respective quality checks and consolidate informationParticipate in committees for information / approval / execution of tasks and decisions related to the rules, products and credit filesNetwork with Risk Instruments, other departments and local entities to ensure proper handling of needs and requirements and ensure fast reactions on changes in market needsYOU SHOULD BE PART OF OUR TEAM BECAUSEWe are those who keep the world moving!You will experience a company culture where Trust, Authenticity, Respect and Integrity form the foundation of everything we do. We care about each other every day.Everyone is empowered and supported to develop as an individual. Through strong ownership from day one, you will experience a steep learning curve and grow on a professional and personal level.You will join a global team of over 30 nationalities and different backgrounds. We foster diversity and inclusivity as one passionate and fun-loving team.YOU WILL BENEFIT FROMYour start with us: We want you to take the helm yourself and feel comfortable from the very beginning. That's why you start with us with several days of onboarding and an individual induction, during which you get to know your new colleagues, our products and our culture.Your salary: With us, you benefit from the remuneration of a collective agreement.Your development: You will find a wide range of learning and development opportunities with us, such as LinkedIn Learning for your professional and private development. We will support you with targeted training from our Learning & Development team, which will help you to further your personal and professional development.Working hours: We offer you flexible hours that allow you to balance work and your private life.Mobile office: This is also possible with us! As a rule, we offer you several days of mobile working per week, always adapted to the team's needs. Please ask directly in the interview what the regulations are for your role.Holidays: With us you have 30 days of holiday per year and an above-average number of public holidays (location BaWü) as well as paid time off for important family events (e.g. wedding, birth, etc.).For you and your family: health insurance through Mercedes-Benz BKK, company pension scheme and capital-forming benefits. You also benefit from regular health days with health checks and free vaccinations.Childcare: Our company daycare centre in Leinfelden and a daycare centre cooperation in Berlin help you to accommodate your children in the best possible way.Fitness: Are you a sportive person? In our sports club SG Stern you can try out different sports such as kite surfing, diving, ice hockey and classic fitness offers as well as our company run, depending on the location. An e-sports community has also formed around various games and genres.Start-up flair and tradition: As the world's largest commercial vehicle manufacturer, Daimler Truck AG has been present on the market for a long time. The Financial Services division – our new start-up – is characterized by its open culture.Diversity: Different characters make us a company! Diversity, Equity & Inclusion have been our motto for a long time. That's why all personalities are welcome here.Location: At our beautiful campus in Stuttgart-Leinfelden with a great canteen, coffee bar, lounge area and much moreWhether by car, bike or public transport: we are easily accessible everywhere and support you with a job bike, a car at special conditions (annual/company car via Mercedes-Benz Membersprogramm) or a company ticket. You also get a free parking space if you need one.Even more: corporate benefits with great offers from a variety of external partners (e.g. for events, entertainment electronics, travel, etc.), employee shares - our list is long. There's bound to be something for you!YOU WILL FIT IN PERFECTLY IF YOUHave a degree in Business Administration / Banking / Economics or comparable educationCan look back of several years of working experience and have a high seniority in risk management, risk instruments or credit operations within a financial services institutionHave a deep knowledge of credit risk analysis and risk related activities and regulations as well as data protectionPossess strong oral and written communication skills with an emphasis on proficiency in written communications / documentsHave a major expertise in the preparation of board decision desks and communication to ExecutivesMaster English in speaking and writing as you work in an international and multicultural environment; German language skills are beneficialGained strong communication and relationship building skills to engage with a range of stakeholders on all levels of organizationYou don't bring everything? Don’t worry! We look for skills but hire for attitude! #MAKEYOURMOVE and apply now - We are looking forward to you! Mehr anzeigen Weniger anzeigen

Willkommen bei Daimler Trucks and Buses! Wir streben stets danach all jene voran zu bringen, die die Welt in Bewegung halten. Transport ist das Rückgrat unserer Wirtschaft und des modernen Lebens. Ohne Transport könnten Fabriken nichts mehr produzieren, Supermärkte hätten keine Produkte zu verkaufen und Reisen wäre für Menschen unvorstellbar.Das Engagement für Gesellschaft und Umwelt bestimmt unser tägliches Geschäft. Unser Anspruch ist es, die Welt durch unser Handeln sauberer, sicherer, effizienter und komfortabler zu machen. Wir glauben fest an die Bedeutung hochinnovativer Technologie und sind uns bei der Entwicklung unserer Produkte stets unserer gesellschaftlichen Verantwortung bewusst.Entwicklungen wie die Digitalisierung, das autonome Fahren und die E-Mobilität stellen eine grundlegende Transformation des Transportsektors dar, die ständig neue Herausforderungen mit sich bringt. Für eine erfolgreiche Zukunft setzen wir dabei auf eine enge und vertrauensvolle Zusammenarbeit – sowohl mit unseren Kunden als auch mit unserem global agierenden Team an hochkompetenten und motivierten Mitarbeiter*innen.Werden Sie Teil unseres Teams, erleben Sie die Faszination unserer Branche und tragen Sie selbst aktiv zum Erfolg von Daimler Trucks and Buses bei! Diese Herausforderungen kommen auf Sie zu: Als Development Engineer*in Communication Documentation System treiben Sie aktiv die Weiterentwicklung unseres Dokumentationssystems XDIS (Dokumentation von Autosar SW Komponenten und Kommunikationsabhängigkeiten zur Bereitstellung von Konfigurationsanteilen in den Basissoftwarestacks) um zukünftige Fahrzeugarchitekturen und Kommunikationstechnologien abzubildenSie begleiten die Entwicklung und leiten aus den Anforderungen Test- und Freigabekriterien ab, Sie erkennen frühzeitig Optimierungsoptionen und bringen diese aktiv in die Entwicklung mit einSie führen User Acceptance Tests und Regressionstest zur Vorbereitung der Toolfreigaben durch, und geben aktiv Rückmeldung an die EntwicklungsdienstleisterSie automatisieren notwendige Freigabeaktivitäten und behalten den Reifegrad der Entwicklungsstände kontinuierlich im AugeSie entwickeln die Test- und Integrationsmöglichkeiten eigenständig und fortlaufend weiter Qualifikationen:Fachliche Qualifikationen: abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Elektrotechnik, Elektronik oder MechatronikPraktische Erfahrung in den Themen:Netzwerkkommunikation, Kommunikationsmechanismen und Netzwerktechnologien für Automotive Ethernet, CAN, CAN FD, LINFahrzeug E/E ArchitekturenEntwurf und Weiterentwicklung von Software- und SystemarchitekturenProgrammierung in Java, Python, sowie Grundkenntnisse in ShellscriptingUmgang mit relationalen Datenbank-Managementsystemen, insbesondere DB2Modellbasierte SW Entwicklung (Matlab, Simulink, TargetLink)SysML/UML ModellierungAUTOSAR Classic (SWC Modellierung, RTE und BSW Konfiguration)Kenntnisse in AUTOSAR Adaptive und PREEvsion wünschenswertVerhandlungssichere Deutsch- und EnglischkenntnisseAusgeprägtes konzeptionelles und analytisches DenkvermögenEigeninitiative, Teamgeist und offene Kommunikation Mehr anzeigen Weniger anzeigen

WE MOVE THE WORLD THROUGH SUSTAINABLE AND INTELLIGENT FINANCIAL AND SERVICE SOLUTIONSAs *Daimler Truck Financial Services*, we are one of the largest financial and mobility services companies in the commercial vehicle industry and a fully integrated division of the globally operating Daimler Truck AG. We simplify our customers' business with a wide range of tailored financing and service solutions and support them on the road to environmentally friendly, autonomous and safe driving.We are active in around 16 markets with more than 1,900 employees. Our colleagues and our value-based culture are key strengths that contribute significantly to our success.#YOUMAKEUS. Become part of our Credit Risk Management at Daimler Truck Financial ServicesThe department Credit Risk Management is responsible for the monthly calculation of Credit Risk Reserves and Economic Capital, for risk steering and reporting for all DTFS entities as well as risk methods and parameters. Furthermore, the department manages rating and scoring models, processes and systems. In addition, the department hosts several policies, prepares Board deals, ensures their quality and fosters further process and system digitization.IN THIS ROLE YOU WILLBe responsible for the (risk) model calibration and validation (IFRS 9 Impairment, Economic Capital and Pricing) for several DTFS markets, including the preparation, alignment and presentation of your results for approval by the respective committee.Ensure the correct monthly calculation and reporting of economic capital and acquisition quality.Support the monthly credit risk reserves and economic capital calculation and reporting process with detailed analyses on drivers for the development of risk KPIs.Maintain and enhance our applied methods, tools, systems and software used for calibration, validation, reporting and pricing.Network and align with Accounting, Controlling and other departments as well as local markets to ensure proper handling of stakeholder needs and requirements.Become key contact for the DTFS markets you are responsible for, including its management and communicate with external auditors during the yearly audit phases.YOU SHOULD BE PART OF OUR TEAM BECAUSEWe are those who keep the world moving!You will experience a company culture where Trust, Authenticity, Respect and Integrity form the foundation of everything we do. We care about each other every day.Everyone is empowered and supported to develop as an individual. Through strong ownership from day one, you will experience a steep learning curve and grow on a professional and personal level.You will join a global team of over 30 nationalities and different backgrounds. We foster diversity and inclusivity as one passionate and fun-loving team.WHAT WE OFFERYour start with us: We want you to take the helm yourself and feel comfortable from the very beginning. That's why you start with us with several days of onboarding and an individual induction, during which you get to know your new colleagues, our products and our culture.Your salary: With us, you benefit from the remuneration of a collective agreement.Your development: You will find a wide range of learning and development opportunities with us, such as LinkedIn Learning for your professional and private development. We will support you with targeted training from our Learning & Development team, which will help you to further your personal and professional development.Working hours: We offer you flexible hours that allow you to balance work and your private life.Mobile office: This is also possible with us! As a rule, we offer you several days of mobile working per week, always adapted to the team's needs. Please ask directly in the interview what the regulations are for your role.Holidays: With us you have 30 days of holiday per year and an above-average number of public holidays (location BaWü) as well as paid time off for important family events (e.g. wedding, birth, etc.).For you and your family: Health insurance through Mercedes-Benz BKK, company pension scheme and capital-forming benefits. You also benefit from regular health days with health checks and free vaccinations.Childcare: As a family-friendly employer, we help you to accommodate your children in the best possible way.Fitness: Are you a sportive person? In our sports club SG Stern you can try out different sports such as kite surfing, diving, ice hockey and classic fitness offers as well as our company run, depending on the location. An e-sports community has also formed around various games and genres.Start-up flair and tradition: As the world's largest commercial vehicle manufacturer, Daimler Truck AG has been present on the market for a long time. The Financial Services division – our new start-up – is characterized by its open culture.Diversity: Different characters make us a company! Diversity, Equity & Inclusion have been our motto for a long time. That's why all personalities are welcome here.Location: At our beautiful campus in Stuttgart-Leinfelden with a great canteen, coffee bar, lounge area and much more.Whether by car, bike or public transport: We are easily accessible everywhere and support you with a job bike or a car at special conditions (annual/company car via Mercedes-Benz Membersprogramm). You also get a free parking space if you need one.Even more: Corporate Benefits with great offers from a variety of external partners (e.g. for events, entertainment electronics, travel, etc.), employee shares - our list is long. There's bound to be something for you!YOU WILL FIT IN PERFECTLY IF YOUHave a degree in Mathematics, Applied or Business Mathematics, Finance with a focus on quantitative methods or comparable education.Ideally can look back on several years of working experience in risk management, risk controlling or risk modelling in a financial services institution.Bring in deep knowledge of IFRS 9 Credit Risk Impairment and/or Economic Capital under the Basel Framework (methods, risk parameter estimation and validation).Have profound background in programming (especially in SAS, R, VBA), MS Office, Jira and Confluence as well as experience in software development.Are motivated to utilize your analytical, conceptual and methodological competencies based on strong ability to work independently as well as self-driven.Master English in speaking and writing as you work in an international and multicultural environment.Possess strong oral and written communication and relationship building skills to engage with a range of stakeholders on all levels of the organization.You don't bring everything? Don’t worry! We look for skills but hire for attitude! #MAKEYOURMOVE and apply now - We are looking forward to you! Mehr anzeigen Weniger anzeigen

Die DCON Software & Service AG ist ein Beratungs- und Softwareunternehmen für Enterprise Service Management. Mehr als 25 Jahre Erfahrung und die Expertise der 120 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter machen das Unternehmen zu einem kompetenten Ansprechpartner für namhafte Kunden wie die Mercedes-Benz AG, Daimler Truck AG, BWI GmbH und die Deutsche Bundesbank.Bei DCON hat Mitarbeiterzufriedenheit einen hohen Stellenwert. An unseren Standorten in Kaiserslautern, Stuttgart und Bremen arbeiten die Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter in einer positiven Atmosphäre, die sich durch gegenseitige Wertschätzung, eine gelebte Open-Door-Policy und firmenweites Du auszeichnet. Wir bieten ein breites Angebot an Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und langfristige berufliche Perspektiven.AufgabenSetze dich Seite an Seite mit einem erfahrenen Team für die Ziele renommierter Kunden ein – und wachse mit jedem deiner Erfolge noch weiter über dich hinaus. Als (Junior) Technical IT-Consultant (m/w/d) bei DCON schlägst du einen attraktiven, individuellen Karriereweg ein und entwickelst dich zum technischen Experten.Du bist Teil eines Projektteams, das passende IT-Lösungen für die Herausforderungen unserer Kunden gestaltet.Du nimmst eigenständig entsprechende Konfigurationen und Implementierungen in unserer Software Servity vor, z.B. auch die Erstellung und Wartung von Workflows, Skripten und Events.Du stehst im engen Austausch mit Kundenansprechpartnern (z. B. zur Klärung von Anforderungen, Abstimmung und Präsentation der Lösung).Du hast Spaß daran mit Daten zu arbeiten und große Datenmengen zu analysieren.Du konfigurierst die Kommunikation zwischen unserer Software Servity und anderen Systemen per REST API.Du wächst entsprechend deiner Interessen schnell in eine verantwortungsvolle Projektrolle hinein.ProfilDu hast dein Hochschulstudium oder deine Berufsausbildung erfolgreich abgeschlossen (im Bereich Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik o.ä.).Idealerweise hattest du mit einer oder mehreren der folgenden Technologien bereits Berührungspunkte: JavaScript, XML oder REST.Du bist reisebereit, da wir unsere Kunden auch direkt vor Ort unterstützen.Du bringst sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse mit.Wir bietenEine intensive Einarbeitung, damit du schon bald voll durchstarten kannst.Einen für dich passenden Karriereweg, auf dem wir dich mit geeigneten Schulungen, Zertifizierungen, individuellen Coachings und persönlicher Unterstützung begleiten. Einen sicheren Arbeitsplatz und eine langfristige berufliche Perspektive.Eine Unternehmenskultur mit flachen Hierarchien, in der wir alle per Du sind, ein wertschätzendes Miteinander leben und das Prinzip der offenen Tür ernst nehmen. Tolle Events, bei denen wir auch außerhalb des Arbeitsalltags den Teamgeist stärken.Eine professionelle Ausstattung ab dem ersten Arbeitstag, bei der du aus verschiedenen Varianten wählen und die du auch privat nutzen kannst.Flexible Arbeitszeiten und dank Mobilem Arbeiten entscheidest du überwiegend selbst, ob du z.B. von zuhause oder von einem unserer modernen Büros aus arbeitest.Eine kostenlose Rundum-Verpflegung an den DCON-Standorten, auch für Vegetarier:innen und Veganer:innen.Eine betriebliche Altersvorsorge, die dir mehr bietet, als das Gesetz verlangt. LinkedIn Learning für Deine berufliche und private Weiterbildung. WE MOVE THE WORLD THROUGH SUSTAINABLE AND INTELLIGENT FINANCIAL AND SERVICE SOLUTIONSAs Daimler Truck Financial Services, we are one of the largest financial and mobility services companies in the commercial vehicle industry and a fully integrated division of the globally operating Daimler Truck AG. We care about each other every day.Everyone is empowered and supported to develop as an individual. Through strong ownership from day one, you will experience a steep learning curve and grow on a professional and personal level.You will join a global team of over 30 nationalities and different backgrounds. We foster diversity and inclusivity as one passionate and fun-loving team.YOU WILL BENEFIT FROMYour start with us: We want you to take the helm yourself and feel comfortable from the very beginning. That's why you start with us with several days of onboarding and an individual induction, during which you get to know your new colleagues, our products and our culture.Your salary: With us, you benefit from the remuneration of a collective agreement.Your development: You will find a wide range of learning and development opportunities with us, such as LinkedIn Learning for your professional and private development. We will support you with targeted training from our Learning & Development team, which will help you to further your personal and professional development.Working hours: We offer you flexible hours that allow you to balance work and your private life.Mobile office: This is also possible with us! As a rule, we offer you several days of mobile working per week, always adapted to the team's needs. Please ask directly in the interview what the regulations are for your role.Holidays: With us you have 30 days of holiday per year and an above-average number of public holidays (location BaWü) as well as paid time off for important family events (e.g. wedding, birth, etc.).For you and your family: health insurance through Mercedes-Benz BKK, company pension scheme and capital-forming benefits. You also benefit from regular health days with health checks and free vaccinations.Childcare: Our company daycare centre in Leinfelden and a daycare centre cooperation in Berlin help you to accommodate your children in the best possible way.Fitness: Are you a sportive person? In our sports club SG Stern you can try out different sports such as kite surfing, diving, ice hockey and classic fitness offers as well as our company run, depending on the location. An e-sports community has also formed around various games and genres.Start-up flair and tradition: As the world's largest commercial vehicle manufacturer, Daimler Truck AG has been present on the market for a long time. The Financial Services division – our new start-up – is characterized by its open culture.Diversity: Different characters make us a company! Diversity, Equity & Inclusion have been our motto for a long time. That's why all personalities are welcome here.Location: At our beautiful campus in Stuttgart-Leinfelden with a great canteen, coffee bar, lounge area and much moreWhether by car, bike or public transport: we are easily accessible everywhere and support you with a job bike, a car at special conditions (annual/company car via Mercedes-Benz Membersprogramm) or a company ticket. You also get a free parking space if you need one.Even more: corporate benefits with great offers from a variety of external partners (e.g. for events, entertainment electronics, travel, etc.), employee shares - our list is long. There's bound to be something for you!YOU WILL FIT IN PERFECTLY IF YOUHave a degree in Business Administration / Banking / Economics or comparable educationCan look back of several years of working experience and have a high seniority in risk management, risk instruments or credit operations within a financial services institutionHave a deep knowledge of credit risk analysis and risk related activities and regulations as well as data protectionPossess strong oral and written communication skills with an emphasis on proficiency in written communications / documentsHave a major expertise in the preparation of board decision desks and communication to ExecutivesMaster English in speaking and writing as you work in an international and multicultural environment; German language skills are beneficialGained strong communication and relationship building skills to engage with a range of stakeholders on all levels of organizationYou don't bring everything? Fresenius Medical Care is the world’s leading provider of products and services for individuals with renal diseases. As a global health care company, we have a special goal: provide the best possible care. Join us to improve the quality of life for a growing number of patients around the world and be a vital part of our team. Berlin · Permanent · Full-time · As of nowData Steward – MedTech (m/f/d)The Data Steward is a key role in operationalization of our Data as a Product framework. As a key stakeholder, you are part of an outstanding Data Governance team, with the clear goal anchoring Data Management across the whole MedTech portfolio. This role requires a strong sense of accountability to shape the next chapter of data lifecycle management. You will work closely with Business and Functional area leadership to improve the quality and value of core data assets.Your assignmentsResponsibilities:Facilitate data lifecycle management and data stewardship best practices with a focus on GDPR Establish quality tools of sensitive data through modifications to governance metrics, processes, related tools, and data architecture Opinion leader in discussions with business and data stakeholders globally to ensure clarity, consistency, understanding and adoption of standard definitions for business metrics Being familiar with GDPR, PII (PHI), legal (DPO), Data Privacy (DPIA) functions to interact as key partner and trusted advisor Orchestrating crucial data flows end to end with focus on meta data management, data lineage, data glossary, data catalogue, etc. Implement new data standards across the data lifecycle to enable new data solutions along our data value chain Help defining requirements for the overall tool landscape and drive change in global processesDeliverables:Be the nucleus of FME, Medtech, DSS and Data solutions in all Data governance related topics Ensure transparency on data assets, access rights and limitations in cooperation with the data architecture and engineering function. Defined roles and responsibilities related to data governance and ensure clear accountability for stewardship of the company’s principal information assetsYour profileEnthusiasm for data and related data governance tasks First experience in a regulatory environment Extensive experience and knowledge of data governance strategies, data quality and data protection management practices. Outstanding understanding of technology solutions, and experience creating data management tasks, e.g. glossaries, data modelling and data catalogue Being a team player with innovative mindset and hands-on-mentality Your ContactTalent Acquisition Care EnablementFresenius Medical Care Deutschland GmbHRef. number 54420Career level:Professional ExperiencedJob category:OtherWorking condition:Permanent / Full-timeBusiness segment:Fresenius Medical CareLocation:Berlin Closing date for application:none - we look forward to your application“The questions that take top priority in our work are how to best listen to our patients' voice, recognize their needs and gear our processes towards them. It's a very fulfilling role.“Sandra LöberProgram Manager Medical Sustainability, Fresenius Medical CareFresenius Medical Care – Creating a future worth living. For patients. Worldwide. Every day. All terms used in this job advertisement to denote persons refer to all genders equally (male, female, diverse).#careerswithapurpose at FreseniusOver 300,000 people across the globe work at Fresenius to provide better ever medicine for ever more people. You love crunching data and want to apply your data science knowledge in a dynamic work environment? You want to work at the intersection of IT, Business and Engineering? Then you will fit right in!The internship is scheduled to start in July 2023 for 6 months. The internship is compansated.Work on current state-of-the-art innovation projects in the field of Business AnalyticsSupport us in designing data ETL processes and creating forecast models based on machine-learning and statistical methodsHelp us in creating production-ready Frontends to visualize our resultsChallenge the status-quo by researching and implementing novel methods for demand forecastingImplement containerized solutions in our cloud environmentThe internship can be followed up with Master's thesisYou will need to show proof that you are enrolled in a university. You must be at least in the third semester of study at the time of the internship.Enrolled student within Data Science, Business-Informatics, Computer-Science, (Business-) Mathematics, Engineering, Physics or similar field of studyUniversity matriculation during entire duration of internship (current matriculation needs to be added to the application) or Gap Year internship (between Bachelor's and Master's degree)Basic knowledge of Data Science methods (ETL-processes, statistics, machine-learning)Experience in coding Python, experience with libraries such as pandas, sklearn, plotly, dash are a plusFirst experience with containerization methods (e.g. Docker) and cloud deployment are a plusGood communication skillsFluent EnglishMore information can also be found in our FAQs.About Lufthansa Technik AGLufthansa Technik is the world's leading provider of maintenance, repair and overhaul services and modifications in the aviation industry. With more than 20,000 employees and over 30 international subsidiaries, the Lufthansa Technik Group offers a full range of aircraft technology services to around 800 customers around the world. What makes us so successful? We do. The people at the Lufthansa Technik Group. Whether engineering, IT or logistics, first-year apprentice or highly specialized professional - we not only keep aviation in motion. We are working on its future every day. We are innovators, technoholics and those who think aviation forward. Our pioneering spirit discovers the next horizon even in the smallest detail. We are Aviationeers. What about you?www.lufthansa-technik.de Mehr anzeigen Weniger anzeigen

An internship in Global Project Management in the handling department of Lufthansa Cargo AG gives you the opportunity to gain valuable practical experience in a globally networked group, to get to know the complex processes within Lufthansa Cargo project management and to independently drive forward your own tasks and sub-projects.Your primary task is to work with the Global Fulfillment team to develop the concept into a worldwide planning and control system for the Lufthansa Cargo cargo flow.Preparation of data sets and execution of process & data analysesSupport in the derivation of targeted measures and the development of planning conceptsIndependent takeover of partial aspects within a global supply chain projectSupport in briefings and presentations for the managementAssistance in the preparation, execution and follow-up of workshopsProject management and project communicationThe following requirements are necessary:At least in the 3rd semester of a degree program at an accredited college or university at the time of the internshipEnrollment for the entire period of the internship (current certificate of enrollment must be attached to the application) or internship between Bachelor's and Master's studies (Gap Year) Very good knowledge of German and English, both written and spokenVery good knowledge of Microsoft Windows 365 as well as first programming experience (e.g. SQL or VBA)High degree of commitment and independenceAnalytical thinking skillsGood communication and organizational skillsAbility to work in a teamFurther information also in our FAQs.About Lufthansa Cargo AGLufthansa Cargo Aktiengesellschaft, headquartered in Frankfurt am Main, Germany, is a subsidiary of Deutsche Lufthansa Aktiengesellschaft. Lufthansa Cargo ranks among the world’s leading air freight carriers and currently employs about 4,150 people worldwide. Lufthansa Cargo focuses on the airport-to-airport business. The cargo carrier serves around 300 destinations in more than 100 countries with its own fleet of freighters, the belly capacities of passenger aircraft operated by the Lufthansa Group and an extensive road feeder service network. The bulk of the cargo volume is routed through Frankfurt Airport.www.lufthansa-cargo.de Mehr anzeigen Weniger anzeigen

Du liebst Daten und begeisterst Dich für Luftfahrt und Logistik? Perfekt, Dich suchen wir! Als Data Officer mit direkter Berichtslinie an den CIO gestaltest Du die Zukunft der Lufthansa Cargo mit, damit wir noch digitaler, automatisierter und datengetriebener werden.Als Data Officer berichtest Du direkt an den CIO und genießt hohe Sichtbarkeit beim Vorstand und beim gesamten Management der Lufthansa Cargo. Du bist für folgende Aufgaben verantwortlich:Weiterentwicklung der Datenstrategie und Verankern einer Datenkultur im gesamten UnternehmenDurchführung von Maßnahmen zur Erhöhung der Data LiteracyUmsetzen der Datengovernance und Etablierung der entsprechenden Rollen in der IT und in den FachbereichenEinführung eines unternehmensweiten Daten-Lifecycle- und -Qualitäts-managementsScouting, Bewertung und Einführung aktueller Industrie- und Technologietrends im DatenmanagementAktive Mitarbeit bei datengetriebenen Projekten zur Gewinnung neuer Revenues, zur Erhöhung der Kundenzufriedenheit und zur Steigerung von ProzesseffizienzenImpulse und Best Practices aus anderen Unternehmen durch Engagement in übergreifenden CommunitiesKontaktDr. Jasmin KaiserHead of ITLufthansa Cargo AGFür diese anspruchsvolle Aufgabe bringst Du mit:Abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium im Bereich Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik, Mathematik oder vergleichbarer Studiengang oder durch einschlägige Ausbildung und Berufspraxis für die Aufgabe gleich zu bewertende Kenntnisse und FähigkeitenPraktische Erfahrung in IT Architektur-Management, Datenmanagement, Datengovernance und in der Entwicklung einer DatenstrategieEigene Erfahrung in agilen Methoden und im SAFe FrameworkKenntnisse in aktuellen Technologien wie Data Analytics, Data & Process Mining, AI/ML und BI sowie in den regulatorischen AnforderungenLangjährige Berufserfahrung und hohe Seniorität und Überzeugungskraft, ausgezeichnete kommunikative Fähigkeiten, ausgeprägtes analytisches und konzeptionelles DenkvermögenVerhandlungssicheres Deutsch und EnglischÜber Lufthansa Cargo AGDie Lufthansa Cargo Aktiengesellschaft mit Sitz in Frankfurt am Main ist eine Tochtergesellschaft der Deutschen Lufthansa Aktiengesellschaft. Lufthansa Cargo ist eines der weltweit führenden Unternehmen im Transport von Luftfracht mit derzeit rund 4.150 weltweit beschäftigten Mitarbeitern. Der Schwerpunkt von Lufthansa Cargo liegt im Airport-Airport-Geschäft. Das Streckennetz umfasst rund 300 Zielorte in über 100 Ländern, wobei sowohl Frachtflugzeuge als auch die Frachtkapazitäten der Passagiermaschinen des Lufthansa Konzerns sowie LKW im Road Feeder Service genutzt werden. Der Großteil des Cargo-Volumens wird über den Flughafen Frankfurt umgeschlagen.www.lufthansa-cargo.de Mehr anzeigen Weniger anzeigen

You strive for excellence in Aviation and IT? You want to use your skills to resolve problems for our worldwide airline customers? You like working in a multi-cultural, diverse and international environment creating great market-leading products for the airline industry world-wide?The Operations Research & Mathematical Optimization team at Lufthansa Systems is looking for a developer with strong OR background. You will be focused on developing advanced network planning and scheduling solutions aimed at continually improving our customers' performance and profitability.Designing, implementing and improving schedule optimization solutions in the area of network planning and schedulingConsulting customers in requirements definition and elaborating solutions covering their business use-casesAccomplishing case studies and proof-of-concepts in cooperation with other teams and together with our customersAnalysis of reported defects, evaluation and implementation of improvement and change requestsMaster’s Degree or Ph.D. in Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, or a comparable quantitative fieldStrong background in modeling, optimization and algorithms (e.g. combinatorial optimization, linear programming, constraint programming)Experience in designing, developing and implementing optimization toolsStrong interpersonal, organizational and prioritizations skillsAbility to work well collaboratively and independentlyExcellent programming skills (C++, Python , GIT)Experience in using optimization solvers such as CPLEX, Gurobi, COIN-ORExcellent problem-solving, analytical and verbal and written communication skills in EnglishWorking knowledge of Data Science/Machine Learning concepts and toolsAbout Lufthansa Systems GmbH & Co. KGLufthansa Systems GmbH & Co KG is a leading airline IT provider. Based on long-term project experience, a deep understanding of complex business processes and strong technological know-how, the company provides consulting and IT services for the global aviation industry. Over 350 airlines worldwide rely on the know-how of IT specialists at Lufthansa Systems. Its portfolio covers innovative IT products and services which provide added value for its customers in terms of enhanced efficiency, reduced costs or increased profits. Headquartered in Raunheim near Frankfurt/Main, Germany, Lufthansa Systems has offices in 16 other countries.www.lhsystems.com Mehr anzeigen Weniger anzeigen

You are a digital pioneer? Ask yourself, “What would I do differently if I could change it?” Let’s turn your ideas into reality. Wir machen Unsicherheit zum beherrschbaren Risiko und ermöglichen damit grundlegende Veränderungen. Arbeiten Sie bereits heute mit uns an Themen, die morgen unsere Gesellschaft betreffen, ob Klimawandel, Großbauprojekte, medizinische Risikobewertung oder sogar Raumfahrt.Gemeinsam leben wir eine Kultur, in der sich vielseitige und qualifizierte Teams ehrgeizige Ziele setzen. Wir schaffen einzigartige neue Lösungen für unsere Kunden und fördern Innovation.Klingt das nach Ihnen? Dann bewerben Sie sich jetzt und werden Sie Teil von Munich Re.Unsere Mitarbeiter sind unsere größte Stärke. Deshalb bieten wir ihnen umfangreiche Zusatzleistungen. Nachstehend finden Sie einige Beispiele. Mehr über die Arbeit bei Munich Re erfahren Sie hier.Entfalten Sie Ihr Potenzial Vielfalt, Chancengleichheit und Inklusion: Wir nutzen die Kraft der Unterschiede und sind davon überzeugt, dass Vielfalt nicht nur Innovation und Resilienz fördert, sondern uns auch befähigt, mutiger und besser zu handeln. Lebenslanges Lernen: Lebenslanges Lernen ist ein wichtiges Differenzierungsmerkmal und maßgeblich für den Aufbau neuer Fähigkeiten sowie das Vorantreiben Ihrer beruflichen Entwicklung. Karrieremobilität: Wir unterstützen aktiv Ihre Karrieremobilität und eröffnen Ihnen mit unserer starken globalen und regionalen Präsenz vielfältige berufliche Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten.Vergütung und Wertschätzung Attraktives Gehalt: Ihr hohes Engagement belohnen wir mit einer attraktiven Vergütung. Altersvorsorge: Wir bieten Ihnen erstklassige Angebote für Ihre betriebliche Altersversorgung. Work-Life-Balance: Wir fördern eine gesunde Work-Life-Balance, vor allem die Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf. Gesundheitsmanagement: Wir kümmern uns um Ihre physische und psychische Gesundheit weit über die gesetzlichen Vorgaben hinaus. Hybrides Arbeiten: Profitieren Sie vom Besten aus zwei Welten – dank eines überaus flexiblen Arbeitsmodells und der Möglichkeit, gelegentlich aus dem Ausland zu arbeiten. Munich Re steht nicht nur für ein partnerschaftliches Verhältnis zu Kunden, sondern auch für einen fairen Umgang mit Bewerbern und Mitarbeitern. Ganz egal, welchen Geschlechts. Wenn wir also die männliche Form von Personenbezeichnungen verwenden, geschieht dies lediglich aus Gründen des Leseflusses. Central Reserving (CR) uses quantitative and qualitative methods to perform and oversee the loss reserve analyses for Munich Re’s group-wide property and casualty business. This includes continuous monitoring of the group’s reserve position as well as the further development of actuarial methods, underlying systems and tools. Additional responsibilities include the financial reporting on non-life technical provisions. With the introduction of IFRS 17 a new financial reporting and analysis landscape will be established.To complement our team of experts in this area, we are looking for motivated individuals to perform in-depth analyses on IFRS 17 closing figures and to translate them into a reporting and business context. I have a vacant position in my team offering a wide range of activities and opportunites!In our department, we are responsible for the Actuarial Function of Munich Re Group and the Group-wide risk model. Our team bundles the tasks of the Actuarial Function: we generate market-consistent scenarios for valuation and risk management purposes, we analyse and review reserves under Solvency II and IFRS 17 and we perform actuarial assessments for the Board of Management.In the offered position, you are playing a central role in the generation and quality assurance of market-consistent scenarios. The Commercial Planning and Strategy Team is part of the Markets and Sales Department at Lounge by Zalando. This cross-functional unit connects all relevant teams to translate the global Lounge strategy into individual local market strategies and subsequently execute them. In addition to driving the local market strategies, the team plans and monitors the market-specific sales of the Lounge. The team analyses the impact of commercial levers on business performance and also assesses Lounge’s positioning and effectiveness vs. competition. Lastly, the team aims to provide the organisation with clear insights and recommendations for optimal commercial steering and identify growth levers to sustain both long-term growth and our local strategy.INCLUSIVE BY DESIGNAt Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. THE ROLE & THE TEAMZalando Stores is a retail business unit within the Zalando Group. We operate 13 (and counting) physical outlet stores across Germany as well as the Zalando Beauty Station in Berlin. As our business grows, so does the need for more efficient, reliable and scalable processes that are supported through technical ingenuity and excellence.As IT Application Manager for Zalando Stores, you are responsible for the day-to-day management and technical application support to internal users and stakeholders of our third-party tools and platforms. Collaborating with Store colleagues, Software Engineers, and Process/Expansion teams, you will drive updates, maintenance and bug-fixes to improve our products and support Zalando Stores’ continued growth.INCLUSIVE BY DESIGNAt Zalando, our vision is to be the starting point for fashion - one that is inclusive by design. We only assess candidates based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, sexual orientations, personal expressions, racial identities, ethnicities, religious beliefs, and disability statuses. We only want to know why you’re great for this role, so please avoid including your picture, age, and marital status in your CV as well.We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Please feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support and assist you throughout the hiring process.do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusionOur employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion/our-employee-resource-groupsWHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING) You are responsible for day-to-day management of third-party applications (this includes but is not exclusive to our cash-till software and price labeling tool). You will coordinate hardware/software implementations, upgrades, and other technical topics with relevant stakeholders across Zalando. Being the internal point of contact, you will provide technical support and problem resolution on second and third level issues. Working closely with Process, Product and Expansion colleagues, you will assess hardware/software compliance with business requirements and identify improvement opportunities. You will create and maintain technical documentation of the application landscape as well as align new and/or changed functionality with our Process and Store teams. WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF You have strong technical problem-solving skills and a solid technical understanding of Windows software and operating systems. You are experienced in stakeholder management and have an ability to communicate technical information to a non-technical audience. You are experienced in either working for a Help Desk, as technical support, or as a product/application expert as well as experienced with technical project management. You communicate fluently in English and German (min. C1-level). You have experience with retail software, distributed systems or SQL (a plus). If you think you have what it takes, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every single requirement. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles!OUR OFFERZalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer. Employee shares program 40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners 2 paid volunteering days a year Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year 27 days of vacation a year to start Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement) Family services, including counseling and support Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass) Mental health support and coaching available Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1usPlease note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email. Cherry is excited to announce that we are expanding our team with a Chief of Staff Venture Capital for our Berlin office. As one of Europe's most successful seed funds managing $1 billion across funds, this is a great time to join the team.We would especially like to encourage female and diverse applicants interested in the space. We love hard-working, hands-on people who want to drive projects and be a part of change. We are seeking a candidate who is proactive and innovative in developing new processes, while also demonstrating the necessary prudence and deference for established structures. In addition, you'll bring your mix of deep pragmatic intellect (absorb information fast and be comfortable around numbers with limited information), combined with an inquisitive nature. If you also have a record of leadership and go-getting in pursuits both in and out of academics and the office, you'll fit right in!You will work directly with Alex, our CFO and Operating Partner, a rewarding role as an integral part of the firm that involves strategic planning, creating and reviewing internal operations and processes, initiating and leading special projects, portfolio engagement and managing staff. This role is a great balance between strategy and sharp execution.This role is not an investment manager position or a partner track role; instead, it is an ideal opportunity to get involved with the firm's ambitious growth plans.This is how you will be successful in the role:Winning - We team up with the most successful entrepreneurs, and like them, we want to win this game. You have the same winning mentality and have demonstrated that in your life. Hustle - You work with a sense of urgency, are effective with time and resources, learn from setbacks, and enjoy a challenging path. Operational excellence - You are able to initiate and manage processes efficiently and effectively with a focus on high quality output and resultsNetworking - you are personable and enjoy meeting new people and learning from them. Analytical pragmatism - You are able to balance an inner drive to deeply understand something with speedAs a Chief of Staff, your key responsibilities will include:Support the firm's long-term strategic planning and define success metrics to drive operational excellenceInitiate and lead special projects, driving high-impact initiatives including, but not limited to, thematic projects, leadership and team offsites, and refining organisational structuresSupport the wider Strategic Resources Group in defining and executing their strategy to drive growth within the portfolioEstablish, enable, and maintain aligned internal communications across the firmCoordinate investment processes such as investment approvals and portfolio reviewsDrive the continued success of the internal administration teamThe ideal candidate should possess: You are an experienced operations / strategy / project management professional (at least 2+ years) with a background within top management consulting, investment banking, or a project manager, operations expert with start-up experience who demonstrates an ability to achieve results with minimal supervision. High academic achievement from a renowned UniversityAnalytical experience working with numbers and large amounts of informationOperational excellence and knowledge of process documentationVery comfortable designing presentations utilising PowerPoint and Excel as well as strong aptitude to work with new software International and multicultural mindset/backgroundWhat you can expect if you join:Learning world-class company building and venture capital at the exciting early stage Travel across Europe, working with founders and our team in Berlin, London, and StockholmA wonderful supportive team and strong team spirit Being part of the European founders' scene and networkingComprehensive benefits package including competitive salary + carry, private pension, 30 days holiday (on top of public holidays). Cherry Ventures with offices in Berlin, London, and Stockholm managing $1 billion in capital across four funds. We are a hands-on team of former entrepreneurs and operators behind fast-scaling companies such as Spotify and Zalando. From our backgrounds and in our current work, we always put founders first. Cherry Ventures has invested in over 100 companies across Europe, including Flixbus, AUTO1 Group, Flink, SellerX, Forto, The Exploration Company, Infarm, Mondu, TWAICE, and Moss.Please send your CV for immediate consideration. The Commercial Planning and Strategy Team is part of the Markets and Sales Department at Lounge by Zalando. This cross-functional unit connects all relevant teams to translate the global Lounge strategy into individual local market strategies and subsequently execute them. In addition to driving the local market strategies, the team plans and monitors the market-specific sales of the Lounge. The team analyses the impact of commercial levers on business performance and also assesses Lounge’s positioning and effectiveness vs. competition. Lastly, the team aims to provide the organisation with clear insights and recommendations for optimal commercial steering and identify growth levers to sustain both long-term growth and our local strategy.INCLUSIVE BY DESIGNAt Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. Solaris is a tech company with a full German banking license. Our Banking-as-a-Service platform enables businesses to offer their own financial products. With our straightforward APIs, our partners can access and integrate a wide range of solutions such as digital banking, payments, cards, identification and lending services. As a market leader we are driven by bringing transformational change to the financial services industry.We love what we do and we love our team. We are 700+ people from over 70 nationalities - a unique blend of techies, fintech enthusiasts, bankers and entrepreneurs from various industries. Our routines are built around genuinely valuing and exchanging different perspectives as well as actively sharing knowledge as we drive our business as a team. We believe and invest in personal growth.About Your Future TeamTo strengthen our team, we are looking for an AML Intern to start as soon as possible, with a focus on money laundering and fraud prevention. You will provide support in the compliance area, particularly in the analysis and evaluation of hits resulting from the IT-supported monitoring of transactions. Another part of your work is the processing of requests for information (Auskunftsersuchen) and related communication with the authorities.Your RoleDaily processing of the hits from our IT-supported transaction monitoring system.Qualification of sanction and watchlist hits Processing of requests for information (Auskunftsersuchen)Handling anti-fraud and money laundering related requests from other Solarisbank unitsProviding guidance and support to employees and cooperation partners We'd love to see Depending on your level of experience, your responsibilities and scope of role will range. We don’t care much about fancy titles, but rather about real personal and professional development, as laid out in our learning framework. Let’s figure together out how you can contribute to our team.Strong attention to detail and methodical approachProficiency in English language, knowledge of German language is an advantageStrong time management skills, problem solving, decision-making and communication skillsDemonstrated ability to collaborate with both technical and business staff Benefits We have a "remote-friendly" working arrangementTransparent framework to support your career goalsCompetitive salaryWhile job ads usually paint an ideal picture of a candidate, studies show that most applicants meet an average of 60% of the criteria. Unfortunately, many promising candidates tend to apply only if they meet all the criteria. So if you think you have what it takes, but don't necessarily meet every single item in the job description, please contact us anyway. We'd love to talk with you and find out if you might be a good fit for us.At Solaris, we are committed to nurturing an inclusive environment, where all Solarians feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a diverse workforce that reflects the diversity of our communities. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of color, ethnicity, religion, sex, origin, disability, marital status, citizenship, or gender identity. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.Information on data processing:DE: https://www.solarisgroup.com/gdpr_notice_deEN: https://www.solarisgroup.com/gdpr_notice_enTo all recruitment agencies: Solaris does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Solaris employees or any other venture in our ecosystem. Solaris is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. finleap connect is the leading independent Open Banking platform provider in Europe! It enables companies across a multitude of industries to provide the next generation of financial services by understanding how customers transact and interact. We offer a full range of leading fintech solutions to financial institutions. We cater to clients requirements, from stand-alone microproducts to all-in-one solutions. We ensure that all levels of digital maturity are covered by our services.finleap connect addresses the fragmented open banking landscape with a “full-stack” platform. It enables partners to access financial transactions, enrich the transactions with data & analytics tools, and ultimately deliver seamless digitized financial services to customers. finleap connect has the unique ability to tap into category leaders founded in the finleap ecosystem, including Solarisbank, ELEMENT and Elinvar, driving additional value to partners. The company is a regulated payment institution under the Payment Services Supervision Act (Zahlungsdiensteaufsichtsgesetz – ZAG)Challenge yourself and join us in our purpose to empower everyone to have access to fair and transparent financial services!About the position:Department: G&RTeam: Information SecurityLocations: Berlin/HamburgRemote status: Hybrid Number of positions: 1We are looking for an ambitious Information Security Manager who is willing to own Information Security and Business Continuity Management as Information Security Officer at finleap connect. You will be working directly with our CFO and our Governance & Risk team, implementing policies and procedures, identifying and assessing risks and working with teams and management across the company to improve Security and Business Continuity. The role offers a very broad impact, with visibility throughout the organization and a significant opportunity to take ownership.You will evolve our Security & Business resilience to deliver great customer value on platforms that are reliable, secure and compliant. Our cross-functional teams are all about working with autonomy, collaboration and sharing knowledge! As an Information Security Officer at finleap connect, you will be encouraged to embrace and get to know more about the business and the innovations in the field of technology and the fintech scenario.We have offices in Berlin, Hamburg and Madrid, due to the nature of this role, it is a hybrid position with semi-regular in-person events and meetings. If you are not currently close to one of our offices, we’re happy to support your relocation.TasksYour role and goals:As a Information Security Officer you will lead Information Security & Business Continuity Management:Primary contact person for all related questions or requests from both colleagues and externals i.e. customers, auditors, and the Supervisory Authority etc. Identify and drive achievement of strategic goals for InfoSec/BCMInstruct process owners on appropriate 1st level controls to minimize risks Conduct 2nd Level controls or testing to minimize or monitor risks Define, maintain & update codes, strategies, policies and proceduresAdvise Chief Finance Officer and Management on risks & control matters including regular reportingLead training and awareness for all staff Lead incident managementComplete the annual Risk Assessment regarding InfoSec/BCM mattersCooperate with and support the 3rd Line of Defence to complete annual auditsReview of customer and vendor contract security clauses and requirementsCollaborate with Data Privacy Officer in protection of personal dataSupport the strategic planning of solutions for the company and its customers, researching and reviewing recognised best practice and upcoming changes to technology. RequirementsWhat does success look like in this role?At least 3-5 years experience working with IT or Information SecurityOrganized and structured in your work, outputs and communicationBias for action and pragmatic solutions Strong stakeholder management skills and ability to work collaboratively with themAbility to coordinate and handle tasks with an eye for prioritizationAbility to communicate issues at both technical and management level, adapting message to target groupFluent in German and English language skill, both verbal and written, is a must. What you bring to the team:Experience in fintechs, financial services industry or Open Banking playersKnowledge of information security requirements & standards like ISO 27001, SOC, NIST, ZAIT Experience of Agile, DevOps and cloud technologiesIT compliance or IT audit education or experienceCISSP, CSSP, CISM, or other Information Security risk certificationsDegree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science or a related fieldExperience of IT security products or services. BenefitsWhy finleap connect?Work with a true open banking pioneer and witness the journey/revolution from open banking to open finance and beyond. Work with colleagues with years of experience in the industry and a true passion and vision for the future of open banking. Healthy work-life balance: Time is precious. Make it count. We enable all our employees to organize their living and working hours flexibly, making it possible to combine personal life with work life! We are ever-evolving and so are you. We have business goals (OKRs) but also personal development goals. Our formalized bi-annual feedback process, regular Engagement checks and personal development budget are available to make sure that we grow together and find everyone's perfect spot at the table. You will become part of a cross-functional environment where you will be empowered through ownership and collaboration; A relocation package and/or visa support for those who need itWhile we offer you the opportunity to work out of ANY of our offices with all its amenities, we have a distributed working style, with semi-regular in-person events and meetings. Productive at home? So are we. Don’t meet every single requirement? At finleap connect we value diverse perspectives and experience.
